description: Svetlana Tikhanovskaya tells the BBC if Belarusians step back from protests, they will be slaves.
title: Belarus protests: Tikhanovskaya vows to stand till the end
title_page: Belarus protests: Tikhanovskaya vows to stand till the end - BBC News
maintext: Why does it matter? Like Ukraine, this nation of 9.5 million is caught in rivalry between the West and Russia. President Lukashenko, an ally of Russia, has been nicknamed "Europe's last dictator". He has been in power for 26 years, keeping much of the economy in state hands, and using censorship and police crackdowns against opponents.
